page.title: 20OPEN SPACES, REIGATE/REDHILL
page.content: We are lucky to have lots of open spaces. To the north are Reigate Hill, Queen's Park & Colley Hill, owned by the{Borough Council & the National {Trust.} Pilgrim's Way, with splendid views, runs along the North Downs. In the south west of the block is {Reigate Heath}- woods, heathland, golf course & a windmill (now a church). {Castle Grounds,}behind Reigate's High St, include the site of the old castle, some lovely gardens & the Baron's Cave. {Priory Park}in Bell St, Reigate, has a lake, playing fields, swings & slides. On{Wray Common,}Redhill, there is a windmill. {Redhill Common}has fine views to the South Downs. Some of this common was bought by the Council on Lord Somers' insistence to provide an open space to replace land he gave up for the Sewage Works in l865.
